original: Yakkhapahārasutta
analyzed: yakkha pahāra sutta
translated: The Collection of Long Discourses 11. The Yakkha’s Blow

original: Evaṁ me sutaṁ—
analyzed: evam me suta
translated: Thus have I heard.

original: ekaṁ samayaṁ bhagavā rājagahe viharati veḷuvane kalandakanivāpe.
analyzed: ekam samayam bhagavā rājagahe viharati veḷuvane kalandakanivāpe
translated: Once the Buddha was staying at Rājagaha in the Bamboo Grove, the squirrel sanctuary.

original: Tena kho pana samayena āyasmā ca sāriputto āyasmā ca mahāmoggallāno kapotakandarāyaṁ viharanti.
analyzed: tena khalu pana samayena āyasmā ca sāriputtaḥ āyasmā ca mahāmoggallānaḥ kapotakandarāyam viharanti
translated: At that time Venerable Sāriputta and Venerable Mahāmoggallāna were staying at Pigeon Cave.

original: Tena kho pana samayena āyasmā sāriputto juṇhāya rattiyā navoropitehi kesehi abbhokāse nisinno hoti aññataraṁ samādhiṁ samāpajjitvā.
analyzed: tena kho pana samayena āyasmā sāriputto juṇhāya rattiyā na voropitehi kesehi abbhokāse nisinnaḥ hoti aññataram samādhim samāpajjitvā
translated: At that time Venerable Sāriputta was sitting in the open air in the last watch of the night after he had finished walking up and down. He had newly cut his hair.

original: Tena kho pana samayena dve yakkhā sahāyakā uttarāya disāya dakkhiṇaṁ disaṁ gacchanti kenacideva karaṇīyena.🔽Addasaṁsu kho te yakkhā āyasmantaṁ sāriputtaṁ juṇhāya rattiyā navoropitehi kesehi abbhokāse nisinnaṁ.
analyzed: tena kho pana samayena dve yakkhā sahāyakā uttarāya disāya dakkhiṇam disam gacchanti kenacid eva karaṇīyena  addasasu kho te yakkhāḥ āyasmantam sāriputtam juṇhāya rattiyā na voropitehi kesehi abbhokāse
translated: At that time two yakkha friends were traveling from the north to the south on some business.🔽They saw Venerable Sāriputta sitting in the open air in the last watch of the night after he had finished walking up and down. He had newly cut his hair.

original: Disvāna eko yakkho dutiyaṁ yakkhaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: disvānaḥ ekaḥ yakkhaḥ dutiyam yakkham etat avoca
translated: When they saw him, one yakkha said to the other,

original: “paṭibhāti maṁ, samma, imassa samaṇassa sīse pahāraṁ dātun”ti.
analyzed: paṭibhāti ma samme imassa samaṇassa sīse pahāram dātunti
translated: “My friend, I feel like hitting this contemplative on the head.”

original: Evaṁ vutte, so yakkho taṁ yakkhaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: evam vutte saḥ yakkhaḥ tam yakkham etat avoca
translated: When that yakkha said this, the other yakkha replied,🔽“Now, my friend, don’t hit the contemplative on the head.

original: “alaṁ, samma, mā samaṇaṁ āsādesi.
analyzed: ala samma mā samaṇam āsādesi
translated: “No need, my friend, don’t attack the contemplative.

original: Uḷāro so, samma, samaṇo mahiddhiko mahānubhāvo”ti.
analyzed: uḷāraḥ saḥ samma samaṇaḥ mahiddhikaḥ mahā anubhāvaḥ iti
translated: He’s a great contemplative, of great power & great might.”

original: Dutiyampi kho so yakkho taṁ yakkhaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: dutiyam pi kho saḥ yakkhaḥ tam yakkham etat avoca
translated: A second time, the spirit said to the spirit,

original: “paṭibhāti maṁ, samma, imassa samaṇassa sīse pahāraṁ dātun”ti.
analyzed: paṭibhāti ma samme imassa samaṇassa sīse pahāram dātunti
translated: “It occurs to me to give this contemplative a blow on the head.”

translated: A third time, the spirit said to the spirit,

analyzed: paṭibhāti ma samme imassa samaṇassa sīse pahāram dātunti

translated: A third time, the spirit said to the spirit,

original: Atha kho so yakkho taṁ yakkhaṁ anādiyitvā āyasmato sāriputtattherassa sīse pahāraṁ adāsi.
analyzed: atha kho saḥ yakkhaḥ tam yakkham an ādiyitvā āyasmataḥ sāriputta therassa sīse pahāram adāsi
translated: Then, disregarding the spirit, the spirit gave Ven. Sāriputta a blow on the head.

original: Tāva mahā pahāro ahosi, api tena pahārena sattaratanaṁ vā aḍḍhaṭṭhamaratanaṁ vā nāgaṁ osādeyya, mahantaṁ vā pabbatakūṭaṁ padāleyya.
analyzed: tāva mahā pahāraḥ ahosi api tena pahārena satta ratanam vā aḍḍhaṭṭhama ratanam vā nāgam osādeyya mahantam vā pabbata kūṭam padāleyya
translated: It was a mighty blow, and it would have killed a seven- or a twenty-one-headed nāga, or have split a great mountain peak.

original: Atha ca pana so yakkho “ḍayhāmi ḍayhāmī”ti vatvā tattheva mahānirayaṁ apatāsi.
analyzed: atha ca pana saḥ yakkhaḥ ḍayhāmi ḍayhāmi iti vatvā tattha iva mahānirayam
translated: But the yakkha, crying out, “I’m burning, I’m burning!” fell right there into the Great Hell.

original: Addasā kho āyasmā mahāmoggallāno dibbena cakkhunā visuddhena atikkantamānusakena tena yakkhena āyasmato sāriputtattherassa sīse pahāraṁ dīyamānaṁ.
analyzed: addasā kho āyasmā mahāmoggallānaḥ dibbena cakkhunā visuddhena atikkanta mānusakena tena yakkhena āyasmataḥ sāriputta therassa sīse pahāram dīyamāna
translated: The Venerable Maha Moggallana saw the blow being struck with his divine eye, which is purified and surpasses the human.

original: Disvā yena āyasmā sāriputto tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā āyasmantaṁ sāriputtaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: disvā yena āyasmā sāriputto tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā āyasmantam sāriputtam etat avoca
translated: Seeing this, he went to the Venerable Sariputta and said to him:

original: “kacci te, āvuso, khamanīyaṁ, kacci yāpanīyaṁ, kacci na kiñci dukkhan”ti?
analyzed: kacci te āvuso khamanīya kacci yāpanīya kacci na kiñci dukkhanti
translated: “I hope you are bearing up, friend Sariputta, I hope you are getting better. I hope that you are not having any pain.”

original: “Khamanīyaṁ me, āvuso moggallāna, yāpanīyaṁ me, āvuso moggallāna;
analyzed: khamanīyam me āvusaḥ moggallāna yāpanīyam me āvusaḥ moggallāna
translated: “I am bearing up, friend Moggallana, I am getting better.

original: api ca me sīsaṁ thokaṁ dukkhan”ti.
analyzed: api ca me sīsam thokam dukkhanti
translated: But my head is a little painful.”

original: “Acchariyaṁ, āvuso sāriputta, abbhutaṁ, āvuso sāriputta.
analyzed: acchariyaḥ āvuso sāriputta abbhutaḥ āvuso sāriputta
translated: “It is wonderful, friend Sariputta, it is marvellous

original: Yāva mahiddhiko āyasmā sāriputto mahānubhāvo.
analyzed: yāva mahiddhikaḥ āyasmā sāriputtaḥ mahā anubhāvaḥ
translated: How powerful and mighty the Venerable Sariputta is!

original: Idha te, āvuso sāriputta, aññataro yakkho sīse pahāraṁ adāsi.
analyzed: idha te āvuso sāriputta aññataraḥ yakkho sīse pahāram adāsi
translated: Here a certain yakkha struck you on the head with his fist.

original: Tāva mahā pahāro ahosi, api tena pahārena sattaratanaṁ vā aḍḍhaṭṭhamaratanaṁ vā nāgaṁ osādeyya, mahantaṁ vā pabbatakūṭaṁ padāleyya, atha ca panāyasmā sāriputto evamāha:
analyzed: tāva mahā pahāraḥ ahosi api tena pahārena satta ratanam vā aḍḍhaṭṭhama ratanam vā nāgam osādeyya mahantam vā pabbata kūṭam padāleyya atha ca pana āyasmā sāriputto evam āha
translated: That was a mighty blow, and yet you said:

original: ‘khamanīyaṁ me, āvuso moggallāna, yāpanīyaṁ me, āvuso moggallāna;
analyzed: khamanīyam me āvusaḥ moggallāna yāpanīyam me āvusaḥ moggallāna
translated: ‘It’s bearable, friend Moggallana, it’s endurable.

original: api ca me sīsaṁ thokaṁ dukkhan’”ti.
analyzed: api ca me sīsam thokam dukkhanti
translated: But my head aches a little.’“

original: “Acchariyaṁ, āvuso moggallāna, abbhutaṁ, āvuso moggallāna.
analyzed: acchariyaḥ āvuso moggallāna abbhutaḥ āvuso moggallāna
translated: “It’s astounding and amazing, friend Moggallana,

original: Yāva mahiddhiko āyasmā mahāmoggallāno mahānubhāvo yatra hi nāma yakkhampi passissati.
analyzed: yāva mahiddhikaḥ āyasmā mahāmoggallānaḥ mahā anubhāvaḥ yatra hi nāma yakkham pi passissati
translated: how powerful and mighty the Venerable Maha Moggallana is, since he can even see a yakkha.

original: Mayaṁ panetarahi paṁsupisācakampi na passāmā”ti.
analyzed: mayam pana itarahi pasupisācakam pi na passāma ati
translated: But we don’t even see a human being.”

original: Assosi kho bhagavā dibbāya sotadhātuyā visuddhāya atikkantamānusikāya tesaṁ ubhinnaṁ mahānāgānaṁ imaṁ evarūpaṁ kathāsallāpaṁ.
analyzed: assosi kho bhagavā dibbāya sotadhātuyā visuddhāya atikkanta mānusikāya tesam ubhinnam mahā nāgānam imam evarūpam kathā sallāpa
translated: With the divine ear, which is purified and surpasses the human, the Blessed One heard this conversation between the Venerable Sariputta and the Venerable Maha Moggallana.

original: Atha kho bhagavā etamatthaṁ viditvā tāyaṁ velāyaṁ imaṁ udānaṁ udānesi:
analyzed: atha kho bhagavā etam attham viditvā tāyam velāyam imam udānam udānesi
translated: Then, knowing the meaning of this, on that occasion the Buddha expressed this heartfelt sentiment:

original: “Yassa selūpamaṁ cittaṁ,
analyzed: yassa selūpamam
translated: “Whose mind is like a rock,

original: ṭhitaṁ nānupakampati;
analyzed: ṭhitam na an upakampati
translated: standing, not trembling,

original: Virattaṁ rajanīyesu,
analyzed: virattam rajanīyesu
translated: detached from things that cause passion,

original: kopaneyye na kuppati;
analyzed: kopaneyye na kuppati
translated: not angered by things that cause anger,

original: Yassevaṁ bhāvitaṁ cittaṁ,
analyzed: yaḥ sevam bhāvitam
translated: whose mind is developed in this way,

original: kuto taṁ dukkhamessatī”ti.
analyzed: kutas tam dukkham essati iti
translated: how will suffering reach such a one?”

original: Catutthaṁ.
analyzed: catuttha
translated: The fourth.
